name: General Segment (Fields That Apply to Most Observations)
description: The OM1 segment contains the attributes that apply to the definition of most observations and laboratory tests. This segment supports master file management for diagnostic services, defining test characteristics, specimen requirements, reporting parameters, and processing instructions. It serves as the foundation for laboratory test catalogs and observation dictionaries used across healthcare information systems.

cardinality.note: OM1 segment is required in Master File messages defining observation characteristics

OM1.1.name: Sequence Number
OM1.1.description: This field contains the sequence number of the OM1 segment within the observation definition. The first OM1 segment in a message is numbered 1, the second as 2, and so forth.

OM1.2.name: Producer's Test/Observation ID
OM1.2.description: This field contains the producer's usual or preferred identification of the test or observation. This is the primary identifier used by the laboratory or diagnostic service to identify this test.
OM1.2.generationHint: Use standard lab codes: LOINC, CPT, or local lab codes

OM1.3.name: Permitted Data Types
OM1.3.description: This field contains the allowed data type(s) for the observation value. Specifies what kind of result values are expected for this test (numeric, text, coded, etc.).
OM1.3.generationHint: Most common: NM for lab values, CE for coded results, ST for text

OM1.4.name: Specimen Required
OM1.4.description: This field indicates whether one or more specimens are required to perform this observation. Essential for laboratory workflow and specimen collection procedures.
OM1.4.generationHint: Y for most lab tests, N for calculated or derived values

OM1.5.name: Producer ID
OM1.5.description: This field uniquely identifies the service or organization producing the observation. Critical for multi-laboratory environments and reference laboratory management.
OM1.5.generationHint: Laboratory identifiers: CLIA numbers, facility codes, or lab system IDs

OM1.6.name: Observation Description
OM1.6.description: This field contains a text description of this observation that provides additional clinical context and interpretation guidance for healthcare providers.
OM1.6.generationHint: Clinical descriptions: 'Measures glucose concentration in blood', 'White blood cell count'

OM1.7.name: Other Test/Observation IDs
OM1.7.description: This field contains all alias codes and alternative identifiers for this observation, enabling cross-reference between different coding systems and laboratory databases.
OM1.7.generationHint: Alternative codes: LOINC equivalents, local lab codes, billing codes

OM1.8.name: Other Names
OM1.8.description: This field contains test aliases, synonyms, and alternative names used to identify this observation in different contexts or by different user communities.
OM1.8.generationHint: Synonyms: 'Blood Sugar' for 'Glucose', 'CBC' for 'Complete Blood Count'

OM1.9.name: Preferred Report Name
OM1.9.description: This field contains the preferred name for reporting the observation on laboratory reports and patient summaries.

OM1.10.name: Preferred Short Name/Mnemonic
OM1.10.description: This field contains a short name or mnemonic for space-limited displays and systems with character constraints.

notes: OM1 segment is fundamental for laboratory information system master file management
Producer's Test/Observation ID (OM1.2) is required and serves as primary identifier
Specimen Required field (OM1.4) is critical for laboratory workflow automation
Multiple data types in OM1.3 support complex laboratory results with mixed formats
Cross-reference fields enable interoperability between different laboratory systems
Essential for laboratory test catalog synchronization and reference laboratory integration

dataConsistency.sequenceNumbering: OM1.1 must be sequential within observation definition sets
dataConsistency.producerAlignment: OM1.5 Producer ID must align with organizational structure
dataConsistency.dataTypeValidation: OM1.3 Permitted Data Types must match expected result formats
dataConsistency.crossReferenceIntegrity: OM1.7 Other Test IDs must reference valid coding systems

businessRules.testIdentifierUniqueness: OM1.2 Producer's Test ID must be unique within producer scope
businessRules.specimenRequirementConsistency: OM1.4 must align with actual laboratory procedures
businessRules.namingStandardCompliance: Test names should follow established laboratory nomenclature
businessRules.codingSystemAlignment: All test codes must reference appropriate standard vocabularies

messageFlow.workflow: OM1 segments enable comprehensive laboratory test master file management
